roleset.name: to close with or as if with a seal

example.name: with a resultative phrase
example.text: One had best not dance on top of a coffin until the lid is sealed [*]tightly shut . ''

example.name: transitive
example.text: In his haste * to seal the deal with Tiger Chairman Saul Steinberg last August , [Mr. Smith ignored a promise that he had made to his own pilots three years ago : that any fliers acquired [*] in future mergers would be `` end-tailed '' -- put at the bottom of the pilot seniority list that determines work schedules , pay and career options .
example.arg: deal with Tiger Chairman Saul Steinberg

example.name: inanimate causer
example.text: Demographics converged with `` mainstream '' and demonizing [*] to seal Robert Bork 's fate .

roleset.note: SEAL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'seal' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Member of VNcls tape-22.4. frames created by Olga (from seal.01-v)

roleset.name: separate one entity from another by seal

role.descr: entity arg1 is sealed off from

example.name: Instrument as subject
example.text: Iron doors hidden in panels close every night , sealing it off from the the rest of the museum .
example.arg: the the rest of the museum

example.name: Agent as subject, all arguments
example.text: He sealed it off from use with chains and padlocks, but we have no explanation as to why he did this.

roleset.note: SEAL_OFF-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in CallHome. No corresponding VN Class. Framed by Claire. (from seal.02-v)
